snippet.title: Dos Madness |  Secret Mission (1996) a Forgotten Rare Microïds Adventure
snippet.description:
Secret Mission plays in Opalia, a small kingdom in south-east Asia in the 1950s. Because of its geographical position the two superpowers, the USSR and the USA, are highly interested in the country. Their agents have destabilized the country, and local rebels, led by Prime Minister Vishaka, plan to assassinate the king. You play Jeff, a double agent, and when you arrive in Opalia, you are ambushed. You wake up in your hotel without remembering who you are and what you are doing here. Soon you learn who you are and what your mission is: to find evidence for the Minister's devious scheme. A complicated mission, as both countries are after his plan and both have their own motives.

Secret Mission is an inventory-based adventure with a big variety of puzzles. The thing that will irk you the most is ... this game is completely controlled with a keyboard (so forget about the mouse , the only thing you can use it for is to open the action menu , or by pressing ESC\Enter ... Space only skips animations\VO )... movement is controlled with the arrow keys , that changes per location (UP in some locations means go Left , in Some go Down ... it all depends on the camera perspective :\ )...you can interact with objects by walking to them , but only when a window will pop-up (in the upper right portion of the screen) when you are close to them (Imagine Larry\KQ\QG AGS controls without a Text phaser)...  and pressing ESC (or right mouse button) brings up an action menu to speak\take\save menu\move\give\open\combine\look .

IF you ask yourself why it is like that ... well this game is a CD-i Port to DOS ... so yeah ... but if you ignore its strange awful control scheme , this game is quite good with a nice coherent story like... can you get stuck ... yes ... but each puzzle is logical in its nature ... if you ask what should i have done next after the Doctor ... is to go back to your room , and see the Picture on the wall and use the Microfilm on it to decipher a meeting place with your contact ... 

Other then that this game is highly recommended by me ... so now you are aware of it ... so go out and play it ;) 

For those stuck , here are Two Lps of this game one from the German Version https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RZzG0Ye0dI8 , the other from the English CD-I https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLB8BD1C06FAD4A225
